intro: Thesium commutatum, commonly known as the slender thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is native to southern Africa, where it typically grows in sandy or rocky soils. The plant is characterized by its small, linear leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas. Thesium commutatum is a perennial herb that plays a minor role in local ecosystems but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and distribution.
